title.narrative: Integrated Program for Dadaab Camp Refugees and Host Community

description.narrative:
1) WASH - Drilling of two (2) boreholes 200-250M deep. Procurement of borehole accessories (submersible pump, control panel, change over switch, power cable etc). Construction of two (2) 50M3 water storage tanks (preferred Steel tanks). Construction of 4 water kiosks for the new borehole sites. Construction of two (2) animal troughs. Construction of one (2) pump house. Pipeline extension 2500M. Capacity building for water management committee members. Borehole Equipping and Reticulation system. Purchase of 2 generators.
2) Health & Nutrition - Recruitment/retraining of MIYCN counsellors. IYCF Emergency training. Renovation/rehabilitation of nutrition sites/shades. Capacity building on EMONC. Community dialogue and camp based FGD. Recruiting and retraining Community Health Workers. Maintenance of health posts. Renovation of IFO main Hospital. Pharmaceutical supplies. Laboratory and diagnostic capability enhanced (malaria, cholera, syphilis, etc).
3) Education - Capacity building of incentive workers. Recruitment of qualified teachers. Rehabilitation/renovation of classrooms. Renovation of school latrines in the 18 primary schools. Procurement of learning/teaching materials and Classroom/pupils exercise supplies. Procurement of SNE assistive/compensatory devices. Community awareness and sensitization campaigns and advocacy. School administration supplies.

To improve access to basic human needs such as primary health care, primary education, clean water and increased hygiene and sanitation standards for the Dadaab refugee camp and Dadaab Host community.
